title: Edwards Air Force Base
summary: Edwards Air Force Base (AFB) (IATA: EDW, ICAO: KEDW, FAA LID: EDW) is a United States Air Force installation in California.  Most of the base sits in Kern County, but its eastern end is in San Bernardino County and a southern arm is in Los Angeles County.  The hub of the base is Edwards, California. The base was named after World War II USAAF veteran and test pilot Capt. Glen Edwards in 1950; prior to then the facility was named Muroc Air Force Base.[3]
